text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We ought always to give thanks to God for you, brothers, as is right, because your faith is growing abundantly, and the love of every one of you for one another is increasing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your steadfastness and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions that you are enduring.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is evidence of the righteous judgement of God, that you may be considered worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you are also sufferingâ€”
speaker: Narrator

text: since indeed God considers it just to repay with affliction those who afflict you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to grant relief to you who are afflicted as well as to us, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels
speaker: Narrator

text: in flaming fire, inflicting vengeance on those who do not know God and on those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will suffer the punishment of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his might,
speaker: Narrator

text: when he comes on that day to be glorified in his saints, and to be marvelled at among all who have believed, because our testimony to you was believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: To this end we always pray for you, that our God may make you worthy of his calling and may fulfil every resolve for good and every work of faith by his power,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered together to him, we ask you, brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: not to be quickly shaken in mind or alarmed, either by a spirit or a spoken word, or a letter seeming to be from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one deceive you in any way. For that day will not come, unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction,
speaker: Narrator

text: who opposes and exalts himself against every so-called god or object of worship, so that he takes his seat in the temple of God, proclaiming himself to be God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not remember that when I was still with you I told you these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you know what is restraining him now so that he may be revealed in his time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work. Only he who now restrains it will do so until he is out of the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will kill with the breath of his mouth and bring to nothing by the appearance of his coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: The coming of the lawless one is by the activity of Satan with all power and false signs and wonders,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with all wicked deception for those who are perishing, because they refused to love the truth and so be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore God sends them a strong delusion, so that they may believe what is false,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that all may be condemned who did not believe the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we ought always to give thanks to God for you, brothers beloved by the Lord, because God chose you as the firstfruits to be saved, through sanctification by the Spirit and belief in the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: To this he called you through our gospel, so that you may obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, brothers, stand firm and hold to the traditions that you were taught by us, either by our spoken word or by our letter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace,
speaker: Narrator

text: comfort your hearts and establish them in every good work and word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may speed ahead and be honoured, as happened among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that we may be delivered from wicked and evil men. For not all have faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord is faithful. He will establish you and guard you against the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we have confidence in the Lord about you, that you are doing and will do the things that we command.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord direct your hearts to the love of God and to the steadfastness of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you keep away from any brother who is walking in idleness and not in accord with the tradition that you received from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you yourselves know how you ought to imitate us, because we were not idle when we were with you,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor did we eat anyone's bread without paying for it, but with toil and labour we worked night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was not because we do not have that right, but to give you in ourselves an example to imitate.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even when we were with you, we would give you this command: If anyone is not willing to work, let him not eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we hear that some among you walk in idleness, not busy at work, but busybodies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now such persons we command and encourage in the Lord Jesus Christ to do their work quietly and to earn their own living.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, brothers, do not grow weary in doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone does not obey what we say in this letter, take note of that person, and have nothing to do with him, that he may be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not regard him as an enemy, but warn him as a brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in every way. The Lord be with you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. This is the sign of genuineness in every letter of mine; it is the way I write.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
speaker: Narrator
